body: Is there a difference to `env` with and without starting it from a terminal?

I don't think so. Here is my output of `env` when startet from terminal. I can't give you the output when not startet from termninal since I can't type.

```
ALACRITTY_LOG=/var/folders/my/gzz9nv7x0wq45khvl83pv4br0000gn/T/Alacritty-87920.log
ALACRITTY_SOCKET=/var/folders/my/gzz9nv7x0wq45khvl83pv4br0000gn/T/Alacritty-87920.sock
ALACRITTY_WINDOW_ID=140599583879712
AUTOJUMP_ERROR_PATH=/Users/home/Library/autojump/errors.log
AUTOJUMP_SOURCED=1

PATH=/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin:/Library/TeX/texbin:/usr/local/share/dotnet:~/.dotnet/tools:/Library/Apple/usr/bin:/Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/Versions/Current/Commands:/Applications/Wireshark.app/Contents/MacOS:/Applications/Postgres.app/Contents/Versions/latest/bin:/Users/home/.cargo/bin:/Users/home/.fig/bin:/Users/home/.local/bin
```

I could run `env` through history because arrow up does work. There is no difference.

Could you try do get a log from the `app` with `persistent_logging` and `print_events` from the `debug` section, using the default config https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/blob/2df8f860b960d7c96efaf4f059fe2fbbdce82bcc/alacritty.yml#L883 

The place where log file will be saved could be obtained by running with this config from the terminal.

Here is the log file when **not** starting from terminal using my personal config file (not the default): 
[Alacritty-90697.log](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/files/11070159/Alacritty-90697.log)
same issue.
@daletman Did you perform any keyboard input during this log?

Same issue.

OS: 13.3 (22E252)
Version: 0.12.0 (1)

Same issue.

I typically alternate between alphanumeric and Japanese input, with the default set to alphanumeric. In my case, when I switch to Japanese input and type any text, then switch back to alphanumeric, I am able to input alphanumeric characters.

> I typically alternate between alphanumeric and Japanese input, with the default set to alphanumeric. In my case, when I switch to Japanese input and type any text, then switch back to alphanumeric, I am able to input alphanumeric characters.

Oh, but if the window loses focus, I can't input alphanumeric characters again.
Similarly, I can't input alphanumeric characters unless I have first entered any text using Japanese input.
There's not a single log that could help unfortunately, as in the one with `--print-events` output, which has keyboard input captured.

This is the log with only `print-events` changed to `true` in the Default config
[Alacritty-64626.log](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/files/11076425/Alacritty-64626.log)

macOS: 13.2.1(22D68)
version: 0.12.0(5a72819)
I'd assume that you've tried to type something? Because it shows that you've pressed spacebar once and that was about it?
I got the same issue, except when I launch alacritty with the `alacritty` command in another console everything works well.

@kchibisov This is very strange because I have the same exact system:

OS: macOS 12.6.3
Version: alacritty 0.12.0

And **don't have this problem** ! (I have used all the RC without this problem). If I can help in comparing something etc ... just ask!
Same issue here.

> 

maybe this bug only affects some IME. I've two non-ABC IME, one has same issue, another is fine.

Same issue:
OS: 13.2.1 (22D68)
Alacritty: 0.12.0

If start from the terminal all good, but launchpad keyboard doesn't work
